text: I’m having a lot of issues making the default Menu module comply with WCAG accessibility standards. There are incorrect ARIA labels, no `tabindex` settings… This is a pretty major deal for ADA compliance. Is the only option to roll my own menu module since (as far as I can see as a n00b) there’s no way to edit the actual default module output?
yep, thats basically the only way to go. But have in mind that you will loose the advanced menu feature tho (if it doesn't matter to your client there is no  more issue on that)
Ugh. Alright. Thanks for the answer (saves me a lot of time trial and error-ing stuff)

some docs if you didn't found them already:
`<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/getting-started>`

its probably outdated tho.
Recently (a few days ago) a new field went out, will be good for you it was called link or url or something like that :slightly_smiling_face:
I do wonder if that link field thing is going to spell the end of the advanced menus
